entry.title: Asynchronous Programming in JavaScript – Callbacks, Promises, & Async/Await Examples
entry.summary: All programming languages have runtime engines that execute their code. In JavaScript, the runtime engine is single-threaded, which means that it runs code line by line or sequentially. The JavaScript runtime engine makes it a synchronous programming language where programs run sequentially. Programming languages that are not synchronous are called
